content.title: Eversion Carotid Endarterectomy
content.statement: Eversion Carotid Endarterectomy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Carotid that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Eversion Carotid Endarterectomy helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Eversion Carotid Endarterectomy include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Eversion Carotid Endarterectomy.

relative: Plaque extending high into ICA (>3-4 cm)
Very short ICA with no redundancy
Need for shunting (more complex with eversion)

exposure.dissection: Expose CCA, ICA, ECA as usual
exposure.control: Vessel loops or clamps on all vessels

transection.location: ICA at its origin, into the bulb
transection.angle: Oblique to include bulb on CCA side

eversion.technique: Grasp adventitia, evert over plaque core
eversion.direction: Evert from origin toward distal ICA

reimplantation.technique: End-to-side or reattach at oblique angle
reimplantation.adjustment: Trim ICA if redundancy needs correction

shunting.consideration: More difficult with eversion - consider conventional if shunt needed

cca_external_eversion.technique: CCA opened longitudinally, plaque everted from CCA

outcomes.restenosis: Possibly lower than conventional without patch

definition.@value: Carotid endarterectomy technique where the ICA is transected and everted to remove plaque without requiring patch closure.

diagnosis: CTA or MRA for anatomic planning
Assessment of plaque location and extent

sources.source: UpToDate. (2024). Eversion Carotid Endarterectomy. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Identify ideal candidates for eversion vs conventional CEA
Explain advantages and disadvantages of eversion technique
Compare outcomes between eversion and conventional CEA
clinical_pearls: Eversion is ideal for focal bulb disease with ICA redundancy
No patch means no patch-related complications
Shunting is more complex with eversion - consider conventional if shunt mandatory
Outcomes are equivalent to conventional CEA with patch in RCTs
Eversion naturally shortens the ICA - good for kinking
